Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim's body was found in the street on the morning of Sunday 3rd May. She had been shot twice.
 
> A [trans woman], not yet officially identified, was found murdered on Sunday morning (3) on Rua Maria Petroski in the Tingui neighborhood of Curitiba.
>  
> According to the Military Police (PM), the body was located lying in the middle of the street by an employee of a company that arrived to work. The [victim] was shot twice, once in the head, and carried no identifying documents.

The victim's death was not recorded in the official TDoR 2015 list released by Transgender Europe (TGEU) in November 2015.

http://www.bandab.com.br/jornalismo/transexual-e-encontrada-assassinada-com-dois-tiros-em-bairro-de-curitiba/

Name: La Monique de Roma
Description:
La Monique was shot dead in the west of the city on the morning of 15th May.

> São Paulo - The Municipal Secretariat of Human Rights and Citizenship of São Paulo released earlier this afternoon (15) a note declaring itself in mourning for the death of one of the participants of the Transcidadania Program , a social reintegration project launched three months ago by the City Hall . The 43-year-old [trans woman] La Monique de Roma was shot and killed yesterday morning in the Jockey Club region of Butantã, west of the city. According to the city, it was a case of murder.
> 
> “La Monique is another victim of a context of high vulnerability. Like her, many [trans women] live by sex work, one of the few alternatives they find for their subsistence, as the prejudice for their gender identities impacts their daily lives in the most diverse dimensions, and especially in the opportunities for offered to them ”, says the secretary. “ We emphasize La Monique's dedication and commitment to the activities of the Transcidadania Program, at which time she resumed her studies after 15 years away from the classroom. The struggle for the recovery of her dignity as a [trans woman] citizen will always be a constituent part of her career. ”
>
> Developed through a partnership between the Departments of Human Rights and Development, Labor and Entrepreneurship, Transcidadania is entitled to a scholarship for those who fulfill a 30-hour weekday that includes school and vocational training. In the first stage, the goal is to serve 100 [trans women] in socially vulnerable situations.
>
> Deputy Secretary of Human Rights and Citizenship, Rogério Sottili, in a text published on the social network Facebook, also regretted the episode. “ From living with some beneficiaries, when I met La Monique de Roma, she told me that she had greatly reduced sex work activity with the financial aid that the program gives, which allowed her to devote more time to study and training. I deeply regret her death, but know that the appreciation of the LGBT citizenship we are promoting in the city will not let her death be in vain. We work tirelessly until we no longer have [trans] victims of a context of high vulnerability and social prejudice for their gender identity. ”

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Rede Brasil Atual 15.05.2015

http://www.redebrasilatual.com.br/cidadania/2015/05/prefeitura-lamenta-morte-de-participante-de-programa-voltado-para-publico-lgbt-8697.html

Name: London Chanel
Description:
London was stabbed twice in the back and once in the neck in an abandoned house at around 12.40am. She died in hospital.

> Philadelphia Police Chief Inspector Scott Small told NBC10 that an argument between Chanel and her 31-year-old alleged attacker escalated into a physical fight and she was stabbed as a result.
> 
> Her assailant and a witness carried Chanel downstairs and put her on quilts outside. They performed CPR on the victim and then called the police.
> 
> Officers rushed Chanel to hospital where she was pronounced dead just after 1am.

Her roomate Raheam Felton, 31, has been arrested. Felton, who has prior felony convictions of aggravated assault, prostitution and burglary, shared the apartment in the 2200 block of Ingersoll Street with Chanel and another transgender woman.

https://www.gaystarnews.com/article/trans-woman-stabbed-death-philadelphia190515-132038/

https://www.phillymag.com/news/2015/05/19/trans-london-chanel-stabbed-philadelphia/

Name: Ticiane Abravanel
Description:
Ticiane was shot 7 times while she was sitting drinking with friends in Nova Descoberta in the North Zone of Recife. 

The police suspected that her killing was an ordered execution.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & TV Journal 18.05.2015

https://tvjornal.ne10.uol.com.br/noticia/ultimas/2015/05/18/travesti-e-morta-com-sete-tiros-em-nova-descoberta-19321.php

Name: Vandressa Vinnitt
Description:
Vandressa was shot dead on the street at dawn on 18th May.

> An unidentified [trans woman] was shot dead at dawn on Monday at Cannon Square, on Bernardo de Vasconcelos Avenue, in Realengo, West Rio. The case was referred to the Homicide Division.
>
> Police reported that the investigation was made at the scene. The victim's body was referred for identification at the IML / Center.
>
> Agents are looking for possible witnesses and footage from security cameras installed in the area.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Manchete Online 18.05.2015

https://web.archive.org/web/20160326125128/http://www.mancheteonline.com.br/travesti-e-morto-a-tiros-em-realengo/

Name: Jean Waltrick
Description:
Jean's body was found in a drainage channel alongside the BR-282 highway on Saturday 23rd May. She died as a result of several gunshot wounds to the head.

> At was around 7am on Saturday (23), the Military Police were called after the body of a woman was found in a drainage channel in the BR-282 in the Frei Rogério neighborhood.
> 
> At the scene, it was identified that the victim was a [trans woman] who died as a result of at least three gunshots in the head. The victim carried no identification documents.
>
> No suspects have yet been identified but P2, Civil Police and IGP Experts are at the scene. The body was taken to the Institute of Forensic Doctor (IML), and is waiting for identification by family members. An autopsy is being performed to confirm how many shots were fired at the her and if she suffered sexual violence. She was identified as Jean Waltrick, 27, who lived in Santa Helena.

Jean's murder was not recorded in the TDoR 2015 list released by Transgender Europe (TGEU) in November 2015, but was reported by https://tdor.info.

https://web.archive.org/web/20151110012914/http://www.noticianoato.com.br/policia/1088-homossexual-e-encontrado-morto-a-tiros-na-marginal-da-br-282-em-lages.html

Name: Bárbara Sodré
Description:
Bárbara was stabbed after arguing with a client who refused to pay her.

> [Trans woman] Barbara Sodré, 29, was killed late last Monday, after arguing with a client who refused to pay for her services. Her killing took place in the center of the capital of Sergipe, where the victim worked as a sex worker, in the first such murder of the year in Sergipe.

According to information from Tathiane Araújo, president of the Aracaju Transgender and Transgender Association (Astra), Barbara was preparing to leave the profession because of the risks on the street:

> Thatiane said that Barbara was preparing to leave sex work, precisely because of the risks involved. Last Monday, 25th, the day she was murdered, she was due to start a technical nursing course and was interning at the Emergency Hospital of Sergipe (HUSE). “I had a conversation with her a few days earlier and she told me that she would quit prostitution because of the lack of respect shown to sex workers. She said, 'Thatiane, they throw stone and urine at us here. No one respects us, '”Astra's president recalled.
>
> Barbara, who was a native of Estância and had been in the profession for five years, had worked in Belo Horizonte and São Paulo, also feared rejection and prejudice when seeking work in another activity. “She said how people would react to her as a woman at work. I was afraid of being rejected,” she added.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Journal da Cidade 27.05.2015

https://web.archive.org/web/20151206104912/http://clicksergipe.com.br/cotidiano/12/4252/travesti-e-morta-apos-discutir-valor-do.html

Name: Priscila Soares da Silva
Description:
Priscilla was shot dead by two men on a motorcycle. She was a person of colour.

> Police are investigating the murder of a [trans woman] killed on Friday night (29), in the town of Dois Riachos, in the Sertão de Alagoas. The 23-year-old victim was shot dead as she drove down Frei Damião Avenue, in a square in the city center.
>
> According to witnesses, two men reportedly approached Priscila and shot her. The criminals opened fire and then fled. The characteristics of the bike were not noted by passersby and tried to help Priscilla, but realized that she was dead.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Sertão 24Horas 30.05.2015

http://www.alagoas24horas.com.br/896617/travesti-e-morta-tiros-em-dois-riachos/

Name: Francela Méndez Rodríguez
Description:
Francela was murdered on 31st May at colona Las Palmeras, in the city of Sonsonate, El Salvador. While her murder has sparked protests and international outrage no arrests have been made.

> The brutal murder drew condemnation from David Morales the Attorney for the Defense of Human Rights of El Salvador, who said it was an expression of “rejection” and “hatred” against the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people ( LGTBI).
> 
> Morales called on the prosecutor to conduct an “investigation of the murder of Francela Mendez, without use of discriminatory criteria, as this would violate due process”.
> 
> The ombudsman noted that the El Salvadorian justice system is indifferent to the murder of trans women which in turn stimulates more heinous attacks.

Francela was a human rights activist who worked daily with Colectivo Alejandría, an organization that advocates for the rights of gay, bisexual, transgender and intersex people in El Salvador.
> 
> Like many LGBT activists, Francela Méndez Rodríguez served in dual roles. She worked to combat stigma and discrimination through Colectivo Alejandría, an advocacy organization she helped create in 2010. She also implemented HIV programs in her community as part of the Global Fund's project in El Salvador.
> 
> In May, Francela's efforts on behalf of her community were cut short by violence. She was murdered by unknown assailants while visiting the home of a friend, who was also killed during the attack. According to Front Line Defenders, she was the tenth trans woman to be murdered in the country in 2015. She was 29 years old.
> 
> Francela's case is far from isolated. For many people who provide HIV services to LGBT populations, managing violence has become a part of the job. Attacks against clients, volunteers, staff members and leadership have been recorded around the world, and their impact on HIV services has been devastating.

TvT project: Human Rights Campaign 12.06.2015 & The Advocate 09.06.2015

https://planettransgender.com/salvadoran-trans-activist-francela-mendez-murder-tenth-for-2015-sparks-outrage/

http://www.washingtonblade.com/2017/02/07/she-is-with-us-forever/

http://www.thebody.com/content/76895/as-anti-lgbt-violence-surges-globally-hiv-services.html

http://www.washingtonblade.com/2015/06/08/trans-activist-murdered-in-el-salvador/

http://www.corresponsalesclave.org/2015/06/indignacion-por-asesinato-de-activista-en-el-salvador.html

https://www.futureswithoutviolence.org/thankful-for-heroines-who-are-gone-but-not-forgotten/

http://www.corresponsalesclave.org/2015/06/indignacion-por-asesinato-de-activista-en-el-salvador.html

Name: Mercedes Williamson
Description:
Mercedes was killed by her boyfriend (a street gang member) on Saturday 30th May after he learnt that one of his friends had discovered that she was transgender.

Her body was found several days later.

> The 17-year-old, who was estranged from her family because she was transgender, had been living as a girl from age 14.
> 
> Friends and Jeanie told police Mercedes had been in a relationship with Joshua Vallum for several months, breaking up the previous year.
> 
> Vallum, 28, a member of the notorious Latin Kings gang, had connections to the criminal underworld.
> 
> Mercedes confided in Jeanie that their relationship was very dangerous, as the gang was anti homosexual behaviour. She said if they found out, both her and Vallum would be killed.

In May 2017 Joshua Vallum, 29,  was sentenced to 49 years in prison under the federal Matthew Shepard and James Byrd Jr. Hate Crimes Prevention Act. Mercedes' murder was the first ever murder of a transgender person to be successfully prosecuted under the Act.

> Harper Jean Tobin, spokeswoman for the National Center for Transgender Equality (NCTE), a Washington DC advocacy group, said the murder was part of an “epidemic of violence against transgender people” in the United States.
> 
> “It’s essential that biased crime against trans people be recognized as a serious national problem,” she said in a phone interview.

TvT project: HRC Blog 23.06.2015 & Al.com 25.06.2015

https://www.thedailybeast.com/why-did-joshua-vallum-kill-mercedes-williamson-his-transgender-girlfriend
